intro: Codonoboea bullata, commonly known as the bullate codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its tubular, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces small, round fruits that contain seeds with a tuft of silky hair, aiding in wind dispersal. Codonoboea bullata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
